div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1829 Bairam-Ali, c. 40 km. E of Mary (676, 1183) (formerly Merv, anc. Alexan- dreia Margiana), Turkmenistan, 1912 Burial: c. 60 B.C. (M) Contents: 42 AR Sinatruces: 34 dr. (as Sellwood 31) Phraates III?: 8 dr. Disposition: unknown â€ Masson, Izv. Sredazkomstaris 3 (Tashkent, 1928), p. 285 Al'khamova, Materialy Iuzhno-Turkmenskoi ar- kheologichcskoi kompleksnoi ekspeditsii I (Ashkhabad, 1949), p. 129, no. 4 According to Masson, Noe 1183 reported to have appeared at Zarkent, c. 220 km. E of Tashkent, in 1924 and comprising 30 dr. of Sinatruces and Phraates III, was the same hd. Masson accepts Zarkent as the find place, but the region around Merv is far more likely
